sentences.english: A shot rings out, blood spatters the man's shirt, and he falls to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 一聲槍響後，血跡沾滿了他的襯衣，他應聲倒地。

sentences.english: They scattered, leaving behind bloodstains and missing shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他們四散奔逃，只留下血跡和掉下的鞋子。

sentences.english: The dog's fur was matted with blood.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗的毛皮上沾有血跡。

sentences.english: Blood-stained and dirty clothes worn by Baby P. His mother and two men have been found guilty of causing his death.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲嬰兒P所穿帶血跡的髒衣服。

sentences.english: Details of the case may demonstrate that certain bloodstains are more probative than others.
sentences.chinese: 案件的細節證實，某些血跡比其他更能提供證據。

sentences.english: On steering wheel, on gauge board, but also moistens has boy's bloodstain.
sentences.chinese: 在方向盤上，在測量儀板，沾有男孩的血跡。

sentences.english: Teri takes Eli’s knife and Kim covers up the blood on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 泰瑞拿着伊菜的小刀，金姆將地上的血跡掩蓋住。

sentences.english: The murderer covered the bloodstains with  a sheet.
sentences.chinese: 兇手用牀單蓋住了血跡。

sentences.english: Door hind has one cuspidor, there is liquid of many courage and uprightness inside, periphery has drop record bloodstain.
sentences.chinese: 門後有一痰盂，內有大量血性液體，周邊有滴狀血跡。

sentences.english: His shirt was besmirched with blood.
Wherever he went, the wound soldier left behind him a trail of blood.
sentences.chinese: 傷員所到之處，都留下道道血跡。

sentences.english: Galaad is a city of workers of idols, supplanted with blood.
sentences.chinese: 基肋阿得是座作惡者的城池，滿了血跡。

sentences.english: Dumbledore hands the bloodstained sword to Harry.
sentences.chinese: 鄧布爾多遞給哈里一把帶有血跡的劍。

sentences.english: Wu Min tested the blood on the sheets and the blood type of the dead.
sentences.chinese: 吳敏化驗出牀單上的血跡和死者的血型一樣。

sentences.english: Then he wiped blood on his thumb away. The queen stood on the threshold, shocked.
sentences.chinese: 然後他擦掉拇指上的血跡，王后震驚的站在門檻上。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
to meet violent death/to get killed
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
